oai_dc:dc.dc:title: View of Alvin C. York grist mill
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Parks; Mills; Water mills; Flour & meal industry; Millraces
York, Alvin Cullum, 1887-1964; Fentress County (Tenn.); Pall Mall (Tenn.); Gristmills; Corn meal; Grain -- Milling; Wolf River (Miss. and Tenn.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The photograph is taken from a position overlooking the Alvin C. York grist mill, located in the Sgt. Alvin C. York State Historic Park. The two-story millhouse can be seen behind the milldam that straddles the Wolf River.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Tennessee. Dept. of Conservation
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Tennessee Department of Conservation Photograph Collection, 1937-1976
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The York mill was built around 1880. The millhouse was constructed on stacked rock and employed a millrace to turn the turbine, which was almost entirely submerged when functioning. The state bought the mill in 1967. The facility is no longer in operation.
